bug.author: MatthewNargol
bug.summary: file_uploader.read() returns empty bytes after app reruns
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
file_uploader.read() returns an empty bytes object after interacting with app. Same issue as <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/2122>#2122</denchmark-link> ? <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>def open_scan(bytes_data): list_data = str(bytes_data, 'utf-8').split(';') x, y, z = [], [], [] for i in range(len(list_data)): if 'MP' in list_data[i]: x.append(float(list_data[i+1])) y.append(float(list_data[i+2])) z.append(float(list_data[i+3])) return pd.DataFrame({'x': x, 'y': y, 'z': z})
uploaded_file = st.file_uploader(label='Select Data', type='.asc') plot_checkbox = st.checkbox('Plot Data')
if uploaded_file is not None: data = open_scan(uploaded_file.read()) if plot_checkbox: st.write(uploaded_file.read()) st.write(uploaded_file.name) fig = go.Figure() fig.add_trace(go.Scatter3d(x=data.x, y=data.y, z=data.z, mode='markers', marker_size=0.9)) st.plotly_chart(fig) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57093252/95849473-6f88af80-0d47-11eb-9cf1-8ebfd0f7f42e.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57093252/95849543-862f0680-0d47-11eb-9964-07d108bd601d.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Yes, this worked in 0.67 <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.68.1 Python version: 3.8.5 Conda OS version: Windows 10 Pro 19041.508 Browser version: Microsoft Edge Version 86.0.622.38 (64-bit)

comments.comment: This is the reason why that's happening. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/2213#issuecomment-712907532>#2213 (comment)</denchmark-link>

Closing this issue as a duplicate of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/2213>#2213</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/2235>#2235</denchmark-link> . A fix for this should be coming in the next release. Please track <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/2235>#2235</denchmark-link> for updates.
